snippet: Energy experts said any appreciable impact on an already glutted global oil market was highly doubtful for at least six months and probably more than a year.
abstract: Energy analysts say tentative agreement on nuclear talks with Iran will not produce any profound impact on current glutted oil market for at least six months and probably more than a year; exports of Iranian crude have dropped by more than million barrels daily since Europe imposed sanctions, and there is currently worldwide excess of almost two million barrels daily.
lead_paragraph: Energy experts said any appreciable impact on an already glutted global oil market was highly doubtful for at least six months and probably more than a year.

headline.main: Iran Deal May Be Slow to Affect Oil Sector
headline.print_headline: Deal in Iran May Be Slow to Affect Oil

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
